most_active_tickets.title: pieces personal cloud - never been able to connect. always a json page saying "unauthorized request"

common_issues.title: Pieces Personal Cloud Unauthorized Request Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users report "unauthorized request" JSON error when accessing Pieces personal cloud. Issue affects desktop app, Pieces OS, and web extension across different browsers. Users unable to utilize cloud features despite paid subscriptions. Browser extensions also reported as non-functional.

related_issues.title: pieces personal cloud - never been able to connect. always a json page saying "unauthorized request"
related_issues.text:
pieces personal cloud - never been able to connect. always a json page saying "unauthorized request"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

as per title. I am a paid user. I cannot use my cloud. everytime with any browser it gives an unauthorized request. 

also no browser extension for pieces works like, none of them 


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "unauthorized request" error affecting Pieces Personal Cloud as it impacts multiple users across different platforms and renders cloud features unusable.
Investigate the root cause of the "unauthorized request" error by examining logs, user accounts, and authentication mechanisms.
Improve communication with affected users by acknowledging the issue and providing updates on the resolution progress.
Develop a more robust monitoring system to detect and address similar issues proactively in the future.
Consider adding more specific error messages to help users and support staff troubleshoot the problem more effectively.
